But in the process of extending Meehan's framework for a wide coverage system, his original design has been radically transformed. It has, however, retained the eleg~It control structure of Meehan's original. This distinguishes it from the early generators in the same style, like Goldman's (1975) BABEL. At the san~ thne the generator described here is very flexible: it can be run in such a way as to produce all the possible syntactically legitimate variations on a given utterance, and has built in facilities to do same synonym substitution.
